  1587. I am really enjoying this professional-grade 54 watt UV light. It comes with 6-9 watt bulbs which are easy to insert. There are 2 tabs to press on the bottom of the unit which opens the light so you can peel off the blue plastic and insert the 6 UV bulbs. Then plug it in, turn it on with a toggle switch located on the back of the unit, and you are all set.<br /><br />When you are ready to place your manicured hands or feet inside the unit all you need to do is press a button, located on top of the unit, to time your cure anywhere from 60 seconds on up to 300 seconds (1-5 minutes), depending on your needs. It also has a button on top to turn on an internal fan, if desired. When I am done using it I turn the fan off, then I turn the unit off with the back toggle switch, and lastly, I unplug it. (I'm weird about leaving electrical appliances plugged in...your call).<br /><br />I considered rating this 4 not 5 stars because it arrived with one bulb broken, but I called Amazon, they found me a replacement bulb at no charge and I had it within a few days. It is my opinion that this UV light deserves all 5 stars. I have used it many times and couldn't be more pleased. If you are considering this purchase, I would suggest snapping it up before this seller is out of stock again and the price (from other sellers) jumps back up to over $100! If you are familiar with how to give yourself and others a beautiful, long lasting gel manicure or pedicure, you can stop reading here. Otherwise, if interested read on!<br />💅💅💅💅💅💅💅💅💅💅💅💅💅💅💅<br />1st I wash my hands and under my fingernails well, using soap, water and a nail brush, then dry. If you are happy with your nail length and shape, all you do is push back the cuticles and gently rough up the surface of your nails with a fine grit nail file until you have taken all the natural &#34;shine&#34; away.<br /><br />Next, use a gel cleanser or rubbing alcohol on a lint free wipe to further clean the oils from each nail. I use the highest % I can find, like 92% rubbing alcohol. Sometimes I use those tiny pre-packaged alcohol wipes. Amazon sells them at a good price. Then I clean my gel brush with rubbing alcohol and dry it, making sure there are no particles, dust or lab puppy hairs on it. 🐕 You can simplify by just using the brush that comes with your gel polishes if you wish. The next thing I do is lightly brush on a dehydrate product (I use IBD's) and place my hand under the UV light for 10-20 seconds. A bonder is next; I lightly brush on OPI's &#34;Bond Aid&#34;, avoiding the cuticles and sidewalls. Now you're ready for the fun part.<br /><br />If you are lucky enough to have nice strong fingernails and do not need to lengthen, shape or repair them, you are ready for a gel base coat. Brush on slowly and evenly avoiding contact with cuticles or sidewalls. Clean up any areas of gel on skin with an orangestick, then place your hand under your beautiful, new UV light (cure it) for 1 minute. The internal fan is optional. Next, brush on your gel color coat and cure for 2 minutes. I usually like 2 coats of color, so repeat last step, cure. Then brush on your gel topcoat and cure for 2 minutes. Use your gel cleanser or rubbing alcohol on a lint-free wipe and clean the tacky layer that is left on your fingernails. Clean your gel brush again too, if using one. Last of all, gently massage cuticle oil onto your cuticles and surrounding skin. You now have a beautiful, shiny, durable manicure which will last 2-3 weeks! I use the cuticle oil every night before bed to keep them healthy.<br /><br />Check out YouTube video tutorials for more information on gel manicures including how to lengthen, strengthen, shape, stamp, do french tips, decorate and remove them. I hope this helps! Have fun!further clean the oils from each nail. I use the highest % I can find, like 92% rubbing alcohol. Sometimes I use those tiny pre-packaged alcohol wipes. Amazon sells them at a good price. Then I clean my gel brush with rubbing alcohol and dry it, making sure there are no particles, dust or lab puppy hairs on it. 🐕 You can simplify by just using the brush that comes with your gel polishes if you wish. The next thing I do is lightly brush on a dehydrate product (I use IBD's) and place my hand under the UV light for 10-20 seconds. A bonder is next; I lightly brush on OPI's &#34;Bond Aid&#34;, avoiding the cuticles and sidewalls. Now you're ready for the fun part.<br /><br />If you are lucky enough to have nice strong fingernails and do not need to lengthen, shape or repair them, you are ready for a gel base coat. Brush on slowly and evenly avoiding contact with cuticles or sidewalls. Clean up any areas of gel on skin with an orangestick, then place your hand under your beautiful, new UV light (cure it) for 1 minute. The internal fan is optional. Next, brush on your gel color coat and cure for 2 minutes. I usually like 2 coats of color, so repeat last step, cure. Then brush on your gel topcoat and cure for 2 minutes. Use your gel cleanser or rubbing alcohol on a lint-free wipe and clean the tacky layer that is left on your fingernails. Clean your gel brush again too, if using one. Last of all, gently massage cuticle oil onto your cuticles and surrounding skin. You now have a beautiful, shiny, durable manicure which will last 2-3 weeks!   1626. I work a full time job and go to law school at night. When I feel overworked and super stressed, I look for ways to make my day easier, and the first thing to go is often my beauty routine. Wear a cute blouse to work? Nah, I'd rather throw on an oversized sweater. Pluck my eyebrows before heading out? Nah, I could trade that for vegging out for five minutes. Paint my nails on the weekend? Takes way too long just to get chipped in three days.<br /><br />I had basically given up on doing my nails at any time during the school year, until I tried gel nail polish. It last longer and can getting it done is a lot simpler. (When using regular nail polish, I always had to do it right before I went to sleep in order for it to dry long enough to not mess up while doing other activities.)<br /><br />This machine makes it so easy, I love it! I can do my nails while watching a movie, and by the end, they will be completely cured (ie. won't smudge the instant my nails brush against something). Everything from the packaging, construction, and function says Quality (yes, with a captial Q!). All of the bulbs come individually packaged and snap easily into place. The machine opens up at the bottom so you can put the bulbs in easily and makes cleaning easier and quicker. When you close it shut, it snaps back into place (I find it reassuring). I love how simple the timer is and that there are many time options. The first option is 90 secs and there are four or five additional options, each increasing in 30 sec increments. The light automatically turns off once the timer is done, signifying that time is up and saving energy. There is also a button to use the internal fan (this stays on until you press the fan button again and does not respond to the timer). The best feature though is that it is large enough for both hands or both feet to fit comfortably, and the opening is large enough where my hands/feet do not bump against the machine while inserting them or pulling them out.<br /><br />Lastly, I use Gellish and Sephora by OPI Gelshine brands of gel polish.   1738. I read a lot of reviews before buying this product and I was still a little skeptical when I got it but I used it for the first time last night and it worked perfectly with my Gelish gel polish. I love that it is large enough for both hands so I could do them at the same time. I was a little confused at first about how long to put the different layers of polish under the light especially since I read a few reviews saying that it didn't set. I'm not sure what those people are talking about...maybe they have never gotten gel before at the salon but you're nails will not be completely set until the top coat so don't try to touch them in between each layer of polish.<br /><br />I did a french manicure and I did the base coat for 120 seconds then each of the polish layers for 90 seconds and then the top coat for 120 seconds. Then at the end you have to use the acetone to wipe your nails of the sticky stuff. It worked PERFECTLY!!! My nails look amazing and they are set. This was my first time doing gel nails at home and I'm soo happy I got this light. It will pay for itself after 3 or 4 times of use. Oh and makes sure you turn the fan on too while you've got your hands in there otherwise it does get a little warm in there. I don't know about the gloves that people are buying but if you don't want to spend the money I just use sunscreen before I start.

This dries the gels so quickly, I may never pay for a salon painting again! I usually have it set on the 90 sec time, but I don't use all of it between coats. I usually try to dry them for about 30 seconds between, then for about 240 seconds after. They are perfectly fine to do whatever I want - no smudges, no imprints. I was having a problem with &#34;tackiness&#34;, but my friend who is an aesthetician to me to take a cotton ball with alcohol on it and wipe them off really well after drying. Then wash your hands. That worked PERFECTLY! And she said it wasn't the dryer, but the type of gel polish I bought... that some of them will leave this residue that needs to be wiped off.

I'm fairly new at the gel manicure process, but it is so quick and easy... For the price of a professional manicure (or less), I have my own light! So awesome!

It is simple to use and saves so much time because how large it is. The price is too good to be true for a light this good.<br /><br />- I can fit both hands or both feet under this light at the same time<br /><br />- The hinged top makes it a breeze for cleaning the inside of the light area or for changing bulbs.<br /><br />- The interior is reflective 360 degrees, your free edges and area under the nail is exposed to the UV light saving you time<br /><br />- There is a fan keeping your hands cool while curing. The fan isn't strong enough to use as a separate nail dryer although the controls allow you to turn the fan on without the lights.<br /><br />- The control panel is located on top of the light toward the back. There is an automatic timer with choices of 90, 120, 180, 240, 300 seconds.<br /><br />The fan, light and timer buttons are lit and all located on the control panel.<br /><br />I'm not surprised that this fan has sold out because of the price.   1829. I received this on election day and I couldn't wait to use it since I had received my Shellac nail polish that I had ordered prior. When I opened the box I was happy to see that the bulbs were packed safely inside of the nail dryer. I was nervous that I might've had a bad bulb but they all work. When I saw this dryer I noticed how nice looking and professional it looked and I was excited to try it. Even my brother was impressed when he saw it. I have never used a nail dryer nor gel nail polish before. There is plenty of room for both hands inside. I used Shellac colors Romantique and also Cream Puff to do a french manicure. I was happy to see that using a UV light nail dryer with a gel polish really works fast to dry your nails! Your nails will be tacky after you dry them but rest assured that is fine. What I did was apply my base coat dry them with the UV lamp for 10 seconds, applied my color, dried for 2 minutes, applied a second coat of color, dried for 3 minutes (I was paranoid it wouldn't dry since I applied more than a thin layer) then I applied the white color on the tips of my nails dried for 2 minutes then I applied my top coat I dried that for another 3 minutes. Be sure to apply thin layers of polish or else when you dry your nails it could look like that dry skin that forms on bean gravy when you leave it out uncovered. I made this mistake on the tips of my nails on one hand by applying the white color on too thick. I applied a thin layer on my other hand it came out perfect. But not bad overall for my first try! After you dry the top coat use a cotton swab with alcohol on it and rub vigorously to remove the tackiness of the polish and your nails will look so shiny! You can immediately go on about your day after you do this. It's been 8 days and my nails still have held up and look shiny like day 1. I love this nail dryer and the ease of use of it. Just push a button for the UV light, one for the fan and one for the timer. The light will turn off after the timer is done just push the button for the timer again to whatever time you want to set it again. I can't wait until I can use it again with my other Shellac color Red Baroness.e timer is done just push the button for the timer again to whatever time you want to set it again. I can't wait until I can use it again with my other Shellac color Red Baroness.

  1865. This nail dryer is not an LED dryer. However, having tried a small led dryer that was invariable returned to the vendor...not this one...I can recommend it confidently. The large size accommodating both hands and feet simultaneously. Compared to the tiny little ones, this one is far preferred for my use. It does take some time to cure but does indeed do the job. Buyers- check the wattage of what you buy. I will remain leery of reviews for tiny little dryers with overzealous reviews. This one has sufficient wattage. A good price. Seller delivered promptly.   1878. I got this for doing gel nails at home. It came promptly, before any of the polishes I ordered, which was a frustrating wait. I have never used one before but the set up is pretty self explanatory and quick.<br /><br />It's big enough for both hands or feet, which is perfect when doing a friend's nails. While gel polishes have varying times to cure polish depending on brand or color, since those recommendations are based off of a 36 watt UV dryer, and this is a 54 watt dryer, the minimum time has always worked for me.<br /><br />The only possible issue I might see for people is that it didn't really have much of an instruction manual, but I'm one of those people who puts stuff together first and only looks at the manual if there's a problem. And as I said, this was really simple to put together so that isn't an issue for me, but might be for someone else.<br /><br />This was a great buy. I will likely buy it again if it breaks (within a reasonable amount of time) and I definitely recommend it.
